The satellite itself may experience technical difficulties or malfunctions during launch, leading to the potential loss of valuable data or mission objectives.
The launch site may face environmental challenges, such as adverse weather conditions, that can impact the success of the launch.
The rocket carrying the satellite may experience mechanical issues, such as engine failure or structural damage, during the ascent.
The satellite's orbit may not be stable, leading to issues with communication and data collection.
The satellite may require maintenance or repairs during its operational life, which can be logistically challenging and costly.
